MemberSignature.Value: public const Android.Util.Base64Flags Crlf = 4;
.field public static literal valuetype Android.Util.Base64Flags Crlf = (4)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Util.Base64Flags enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Encoder flag bit to indicate lines should be terminated with a CRLF pair instead of just an LF.

Docs.param: the input array to decode
controls certain features of the decoded output. Pass DEFAULT to decode standard Base64.

Docs.exception: if the input contains incorrect padding

.field public static literal valuetype Android.Util.Base64Flags NoClose = (16)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Util.Base64Flags enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Flag to pass to to indicate that it should not close the output stream it is wrapping when it itself is closed.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Android.Util.Base64Flags NoPadding = 1;

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Util.Base64Flags enum directly instead of this field.")

MemberSignature.Value: public const Android.Util.Base64Flags NoWrap = 2;
.field public static literal valuetype Android.Util.Base64Flags NoWrap = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Util.Base64Flags enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Encoder flag bit to omit all line terminators (i.e., the output will be on one long line).

MemberSignature.Value: public const Android.Util.Base64Flags UrlSafe = 8;
.field public static literal valuetype Android.Util.Base64Flags UrlSafe = (8)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Util.Base64Flags enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Encoder/decoder flag bit to indicate using the "URL and filename safe" variant of Base64 (see RFC 3548 section 4) where - and _ are used in place of + and /.
